title: Automated Identification of Eviction Status from Electronic Health Record Notes. (arXiv:2212.02762v2 [cs.CL] UPDATED)
abstract: Objective: Evictions are important social and behavioral determinants of health. Evictions are associated with a cascade of negative events that can lead to unemployment, housing insecurity/homelessness, long-term poverty, and mental health problems. In this study, we developed a natural language processing system to automatically detect eviction status from electronic health record (EHR) notes.  Materials and Methods: We first defined eviction status (eviction presence and eviction period) and then annotated eviction status in 5000 EHR notes from the Veterans Health Administration (VHA). We developed a novel model, KIRESH, that has shown to substantially outperform other state-of-the-art models such as fine-tuning pre-trained language models like BioBERT and BioClinicalBERT. Moreover, we designed a novel prompt to further improve the model performance by using the intrinsic connection between the two sub-tasks of eviction presence and period prediction. Finally, we used the Temperatur

Title: Automated Identification of Eviction Status from Electronic Health Record Notes. (arXiv:2212.02762v2 [cs.CL] UPDATED)
Abstract: Objective: Evictions are important social and behavioral determinants of health. Evictions are associated with a cascade of negative events that can lead to unemployment, housing insecurity/homelessness, long-term poverty, and mental health problems. In this study, we developed a natural language processing system to automatically detect eviction status from electronic health record (EHR) notes. We developed a novel model, KIRESH, that has shown to substantially outperform other state-of-the-art models such as fine-tuning pre-trained language models like BioBERT and BioClinicalBERT. Moreover, we designed a novel prompt to further improve the model performance by using the intrinsic connection between the two sub-tasks of eviction presence and period prediction. translated_title: 自动化从电子健康档案记录中识别逐出状态
translated_abstract: 目标：逐出是健康的重要社会和行为决定因素。逐出与一系列负面事件相关，可能导致失业、住房不安全/无家可归、长期贫困和精神健康问题。在本研究中，我们开发了一种自然语言处理系统，可以自动从电子健康档案（EHR）记录中检测到逐出状态。
tldr: 本研究开发了一种自然语言处理系统，可以自动从电子健康档案（EHR）记录中检测到逐出状态，并开发了一个新颖的模型KIRESH，已经显示出明显优于其他最先进的模型。
en_tdlr: This study developed a natural language processing system to automatically detect eviction status from electronic health records (EHRs) and developed a novel model, KIRESH, that outperforms other state-of-the-art models.
